app_metadata.description: RomM allows you to scan, enrich, browse and play your game collection with a clean and responsive interface. With support for multiple platforms, various naming schemes, and custom tags, RomM is a must-have for anyone who plays on emulators.
app_metadata.name: romm

run_as_context.description: Romm runs as any non-root user.

app_metadata.title: Romm

groups.name: Romm Configuration
groups.description: Deploy RomM by selecting from the following options, but when in doubt use the defaults.

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for Romm

groups.name: Storage Configuration
groups.description:
RomM uses two internal persistent volumes: one (resources) for cover art and screenshots, and another (assets) for saves, states, and other adjacent files.
You'll want to mount two others (library and config) for the ROM library and the config.yml file.

groups.name: Resources Configuration
groups.description:
The defaults should work for most people.
You may with to increase memory limits if you have an extensive ROM library (20K+ games).

attrs.label: Postgres Image (CAUTION)
attrs.description:
If you are changing this after the postgres directory has been initialized,</br>
STOP! and make sure you have a backup of your data.</br>
Changing this will trigger an one way database upgrade.</br>
You can only select newer versions of postgres.</br>
Selecting an older version will refuse to start.</br>
If something goes wrong, you will have to restore from backup.

enum.description: Postgres 17

attrs.label: Database Password
attrs.description: The password for Postgres

attrs.label: Redis Password
attrs.description: The password for Romm.

attrs.label: Auth Secret Key
attrs.description: Generate a key with `openssl rand -hex 32`

attrs.label: IGDB Client ID
attrs.description: Generate an ID and SECRET for IGDB (https://api-docs.igdb.com/#account-creation)

attrs.label: MobyGames API Key
attrs.description: Generate an API key for MobyGames (https://www.mobygames.com/info/api)

attrs.label: SteamGridDB API Key
attrs.description: Generate an API key for SteamGridDB (https://github.com/rommapp/romm/wiki/Generate-API-Keys#steamgriddb)

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables for Romm.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that Romm files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that Romm files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access
Expose port for inter-container communication
None

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: Automatic Permissions
attrs.description:
Automatically set permissions for the host path.
Enabling this, will check the top level directory,</br>
If it finds incorrect permissions, it will `chown` the
host path to the user and group required for the
postgres container.

attrs.description: Additional storage for Romm.

ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>

SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.

1.0.4.readme:
RomM

Your beautiful, powerful, self-hosted ROM manager

RomM allows you to scan, enrich, and browse your game collection with a clean and responsive interface. With support for multiple platforms, various naming schemes, and custom tags, RomM is a must-have for anyone who plays on emulators.
